summary: Email chain between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and the FBI regarding the transfer of search warrant materials from the Epstein investigation. The FBI is preparing electronic evidence (emails, data from devices) for loading into the Relativity review platform and requests a 1TB hard drive for the transfer.

persons.name: Steve
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is following up on the status of electronic evidence processing from the Epstein search warrants, concerned about timing.

persons.name: Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: FBI examiner handling the processing of electronic evidence from Epstein search warrants, including creating load files for Relativity and managing data from devices and a DVR system.

connections.description: Working together on the transfer and processing of electronic evidence from the Epstein investigation, with Steve requesting status updates and the examiner providing technical assistance.

events.title: FBI Prepares Epstein Search Warrant Materials for Transfer
events.description: The FBI informs the U.S. Attorney's Office that load files for electronic evidence from Epstein search warrants will be ready by Thursday COB and requests a 1TB hard drive for data transfer to Relativity.

events.title: Epstein Search Warrants Executed
events.description: Reference to search warrant materials from the Epstein investigation, including data from a New York residence search (5-6 iMacs, 5 laptops) and materials from an island location.

locations: Island (likely referring to Little St. James, Epstein's private island)
keyFacts: The FBI was processing a large volume of electronic evidence from Epstein search warrants, primarily emails, for transfer to the U.S. Attorney's Office via a 1TB hard drive.
Evidence included data from approximately 5-6 iMacs and 5 laptop computers seized from a New York residence, with island materials (including a DVR system) still being processed.
The U.S. Attorney's Office case number for the Epstein investigation is 2018R01618.
Processing delays were noted due to the complexity and volume of the electronic evidence.
